gurmukhi: ikqY Kwn bwnIn hUM AsqR Jwry ] shI swh sMgRwm surgM isDwry ]22]
transliteration: Kitai Khaan Baanoon Hoon Astra Jhdare|| Sah9 Saah Sanraam Suragadg Sidhdare||22||
translation: Several skillful Khans fell on him with their arms and sent Shah Sangram to heaven.22.

gurmukhi: mwir njwbq Kwn ko sMgo juJY juJwr ]
transliteration: Daar(i) Najaabat Khaan Ko Sano Jujhai Jujhaar||
translation: The brave warrior Sago Shah fell down after killing Najbat Khan.

gurmukhi: hw hw ieh lokY BieE surg lok jYkwr ]23]
transliteration: Haa Haa Ih Lokai Bhaio Surag Lok Jaikaar||23||
translation: There were lamentations in his world and rejoicing in heaven.23.

gurmukhi: lKy swh sMgRwm ju`Jy juJwrM ] qvM kIt bwxM kmwxM sMBwrM ]
transliteration: Lakhe Saah Sanhaam Jujjhe Jujhaaran|| Tavan Koot Baanan Kamaanan Sanbhaaran||
translation: When this lowly person saw Shah Sangram falling (while fighting bravely) he held aloft his bow and arrows.

gurmukhi: hinXo eyk KwnM iKAwlM KqMgM ] fisXo sqRu ko jwnu sXwmM BujMgM ]24]
transliteration: Haniyo Ek Khaanan Khiaalan Khatanadg|| Dasiyo Satru Ko Jaan(u) Syaamannd Bhujanadg||24||
translation: He, fixing his gaze on a Khan, shot an arrow, which stung the enemy like a black cobra, who (the Khan) fell down.24.

gurmukhi: igirXo BUm so bwx dUjo sMBwrXo ] muKM BIKnM Kwn ky qwn mwrXo ]
transliteration: Giriyo Bhoom So Baan Doojo Sanbhdaryo|| Moukhanndbhookhanan Khaan Ke Taan Mdaryo||
translation: He drew out another arrow and aimed and shot it on the face of Bhikhan Khan.

gurmukhi: BijXo Kwn KUnI rihXo Kyq qwjI ] qjy pRwx qIjy lgy bwx bwjI ]25]
transliteration: Bhajiyo Khaan Khoonoo Rahiyo Khet Taajoo|| Taje Praan Tooje Lage Baan Baajoo||25||
translation: The bloody Khan fled away leaving his horse in the field, who was killed with the third arrow.25.

gurmukhi: CutI mUrCnw hrIcMdM sMBwry ] ghy bwx kwmwn By AYNc mwry ]
transliteration: Chhoutoo Moondchhanaa Daroochanndan Sanbhdare|| Gade Baan Kaamaan Bhe Ainch Mdare||
translation: After regaining consciousness from the swoon, Hari Chand shot his arrows with unerring aim.

gurmukhi: lgy AMg jw ky rhy nw sMBwrM ] qnM iqAwg qy dyvlokM pDwrM ]26]
transliteration: Lage An Jaa Ke Rahe Naa Sanbhaaran|| Tanan Tiaag Te Devlokan Padhaaran||26||
translation: Whosoever was struck, fell down unconscious, and leaving his body, went to the heavenly abode.26.

gurmukhi: duXM bwn KYNcy iekM bwr mwry ] blI bIr bwjIn qwjI ibdwry ]
transliteration: Duyan Baan Khainche Ikan Baar Mdare|| Badoo Boor Baajoon Taajoo Biddare||
translation: He aimed and shot two arrows at the same time and did not care for the selection of his target.

gurmukhi: ijsY bwn lwgY rhY n sMBwrM ] qnM byiD kY qwih pwrM isDwrM ]27]
transliteration: Jisai Baan Laagad Rahai Na Sanbhaaran|| Tanan Bedh(i) Kai Taah(i) Paaran Sidhaaran||27||
translation: Whosoever was struck and pierced by his arrow, went straight to the other world.27.

gurmukhi: sBY s√çwim DrmM su bIrM sMBwry ] fkI fwkxI BUq pRyqM bkwry ]
transliteration: Sabhai Svaam(i) Dharamannd Su Booran Sanbhdare|| Dakoo Daakanoo Bhoot Pretan Bakdare||
translation: The warriors remained true to their duty in the field, the witches and ghosts drank blood to their fill and raised shrill voices.
